country:
None
text:
This was my first try at apple pie and it turned out great! After I read all the reviews I did had cinamin and nutmeg and a dash of vanilla. I also put in about a tbs. of flour. I poured the carmel mixture in with the apples and left a little bit to pour over the crust. I used ready made crust and brushed it with egg wash. I poured the rest of the carmel sauce over it and sprinkled just a little bit of sugar. You only need 6 apples at the most! I did half granny smith and half pink lady and cooked it for 50 minutes. My husband went nuts over it! Said it was the best apple pie he ever had! I was pleased as pie!!
Review:

I couldn't fit 8 whole apples in, even though I tried to use up every available space with smaller chunks of apple.  And I had no problems with using Granny Smith; was definitely sweet enough!  Great recipe! :)

text:
The pies turned out fine but the quantities in that recipe are wacky.  She must've been using the world's smallest Granny Smith Apples, because I bought 8, ended up using 6, and the 6 I used were enough to fill 2 deep dish pie crusts.  I also added cinnamon to the apples.  This was a much less dry apple pie than I'm used to; I usually don't like them because the crust is incredibly dry and powdery, but the liquid on top of this helped.  I like the gooeyness in the middle.  Served with ice cream.

text:
This is the best apple pie I have ever had and ever made. Just a few key ingredients... simple and perfect. I used the pie shell mix from Betty Crocker I think, the one where you just add water and it turned out buttery and flakey. I used half Granny Smith and half Fuji. It made it Sweet and Sour! I listened to some of the reviewers and poured the mixture when it was half way stacked and then the rest on top. Left a little bit of the mixure to brush the top crust. I can't tell you enough about this recipe. I was soooo good. Add real whipping cream or vanilla ice cream and it makes it even better.

text:
This is a perfectly nice apple pie that is very easy to make. I would probably have rated this pie more highly if I weren't expecting so much more.  The reviews I read here were, in my opinion, misleading.  This pie is perfectly good.  Everybody liked it, and I would probably make it again.  My only problem with the reviews that I read is that I was led to expect something AWESOME.  Anyway, if you want to make a perfectly good apple pie that is extremely easy, this is definitely the way to go.

text:
I think we messed up on the sauce that you pour over top, but I won't let that affect my rating. Just to help someone, don't let the sauce cook for any longer than said, as it becomes so thick that after pouring on top and cooking it just hardens and is not easy to chew. Also, the apples seemed so mushy. I prefer a harder bite to the apples in pies... but the taste over all is worth of 4, and using a homemade pie crust is a must.
Review:
Rating:
4

text:
I think we messed up on the sauce that you pour over top, but I won't let that affect my rating. Just to help someone, don't let the sauce cook for any longer than said, as it becomes so thick that after pouring on top and cooking it just hardens and is not easy to chew. Also, the apples seemed so mushy. I prefer a harder bite to the apples in pies... but the taste over all is worth of 4, and using a homemade pie crust is a must.

text:
A five for:
-Taste
-Presentation
-Easiness/Not Complicated

The taste is wonderful--it has a carmel taste to it from the syrup.
The changes I made were as follows: I added a few shakes of cinnamon (my favorite spice =]) and a pinch of clove to the sauce due to some reviewer's suggestions. Also, I used 5 Granny Smiths and 3 Gala apples.

When I make this again, I will be sure not to use 8 apples because it was too much.

photo:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am not an apple pie fan, but I am always looking for a better recipe for my boyfriend.  This pie looked and smelled heavenly as I was baking it.  I even took a pic of it fresh out of the oven because it looked just like a pie on TV!  The inside was tasty, the crust was outstanding, but it was a tad runny.  I think I needed to bake it the full 45 minutes (in addition to the 15 min. @ 425).  I did add apple pie spices and toss the apples in the caramel sauce before piling the apples in the crust.  Then I covered the apples with a second full crust and brushed a little of the caramel sauce on the crust.  The crust was outstanding!
Review:

4

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/250730.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This pie is delicious! I took a few liberties with the recipe. I used salted butter. Eight apples is too many, I used 6 Granny Smith apples and 5 would have worked fine. I added a teaspoon of cinnamon to the sauce. I used Pillsbury ready crusts and I didn't lattice the top, just poured the sauce over the apples and put on the top crust, then brushed the crust with milk so it would brown. Luckily I put a pan under this, it ran over and would have made a terrible mess otherwise. Baking time isn't quite long enough, I baked it 55 minutes during the 350 phase. This was great with ice cream, a different slant on apple pie because of the caramel taste. This recipe will never take the place of my traditional apple pie recipe, but it is very good and I will make it again.
Review:

text:
This pie is delicious! I took a few liberties with the recipe. I used salted butter. Eight apples is too many, I used 6 Granny Smith apples and 5 would have worked fine. I added a teaspoon of cinnamon to the sauce. I used Pillsbury ready crusts and I didn't lattice the top, just poured the sauce over the apples and put on the top crust, then brushed the crust with milk so it would brown. Luckily I put a pan under this, it ran over and would have made a terrible mess otherwise. Baking time isn't quite long enough, I baked it 55 minutes during the 350 phase. This was great with ice cream, a different slant on apple pie because of the caramel taste. This recipe will never take the place of my traditional apple pie recipe, but it is very good and I will make it again.

country:
None
text:
Even my Grandmother liked this pie!!  It was a detour from the method I grew up with where you would mix all of the spices and suger with the apples before putting them into the crust, dab it with raw butter and put the crust on (sprinkling sugar on the crust) yet easy and delicious. 

I did not make a lattice top, but just poured most of the sauce into the pie, covered it with a regular crust and brushed the rest of the sauce on the top crust before putting it into the oven. 

The other thing I experienced is that while I baked mine for the maximum time listed on the recipe (and don't live at a high altitude), the apples weren't quite cooked enough for me so I would bake it longer.  

Otherwise, a great apple pie and I am an apple pie junkie. : )

Even my Grandmother liked this pie!!  It was a detour from the method I grew up with where you would mix all of the spices and suger with the apples before putting them into the crust, dab it with raw butter and put the crust on (sprinkling sugar on the crust) yet easy and delicious.

text:
I used a version of this apple pie recipe and won 2nd place at the San Diego Fair. My girlfriend doesn't like apple pie but she loves this recipe. I use a homemade shortbread crust and use an oatmeal steudel on the top. I have never had a problem with sogginess and I make sure to mix the apples with the caramel and then place them in the crust. Like other reviewers I use cinnamon and even sprinkle some in the bottom of the crust prior to baking. One judge at the fair said it was the best pie he ever tasted!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this pie so many times I can't begin to count the times. I've made it every Thanksgiving for several years as well as many times during apple season. Since I found this recipe I don't even bother looking for another recipe. I even know this recipe by heart. This is THE best apple pie recipe hand down! Everybody LOVES this pie! I've shared the recipe many times. I've read several posts about forgoing the lattice top - that makes me sad because one of the great bonuses about this pie recipe is that it turns out so beautiful and everyone is soooo impressed when they see it. This pie is so quick and easy to make. The weaving is super easy but if you don't want to tackle it or don't have time, just lay all of the horizontal strips all at once then put all of the vertical strips on top without weaving them. Honestly it's not even that noticeable that it's not actually weaved when it comes out of the oven.  I like to use a variety of apples. That always turns out best. I have a pear tree, so sometimes I mix in pears or make a pear pie. I do add a little cinnamon (when I think about it). I decrease the sugar to 1/3 cup of each instead of 1/2 cup. I do this with every dessert recipe and nobody ever notices. I always wait about making the syrup so it doesn't thicken too much. It's ok to pour it over the apples before you put the top on but be sure to save some to brush on top. You can add a few drops of water if it's too thick to brush on. Don't skip it. It makes the crust ta

text:
Turned put fabulous. I added cinnamon and nutmeg to my sugar mixture and also tossed the apples in some of the mixture before placing them in the pie?? helpful hint! Don't make your sugar sauce until you have the pie fully completed or it will harden up on you before you can pour it over...so make it last. Also unless you want a stove covered in apples and sugar place your pie on a cookie sheet with tin fold on it for easy clean up at the end.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is my apple pie go-to starter recipe. I do a couple things different is why I rated a 4. With my changes its a perfect 10. Always beautiful, taste is amazing and ALWAYS gets eaten first at the holidays. I put 3/4 tsp pumpkin pie spice in with the butter/sugar mixture. I have all my apples peeled, sliced and in a bowl. I then pour my butter/sugar mixture over the apples in the bowl, give it a good stir and let it sit while I put my crust in my pie dish. I DO NOT pour the mixture over the top crust. I use an egg white wash over the top and sprinkle sugar crystals over the top. Boom... Perfect pie, every time. :-)

userID:
14669579
Display Name:
Patti
isPro:

followersCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677172.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm not a big fan of apple pie but my husband is.  So after 31 years of marriage I decided to make him one.  I'm not a pie baker - but this is EASY and The Best apple pie I've ever tasted.  I did add cinnamon and also sprinkled the top with cinnamon and sugar as my husband likes cinnamon in an apple pie.  If you read Opel's grand-daughter's story - I get the feeling that Opel might have added it too if she had had it on hand the day she created it.  for this first attempt I did not make the lattice top - but after watching the video of how to do that - I will do it next time I make it.  This time I just put a regular top crust on it - poking holes in the top to let out steam.  And because of this I had to mix the sugar and butter mixture into the apples before putting them into the pie.  I baked it exactly as Opel instructed (adding some tinfoil around the edges to keep them from getting too dark as mine seem to always do if I don't put the foil around the edges - I also tented it with foil the last 1/2 hour as my pies have always gotten dark crusts if I don't).  You can see that I have to put some safe-holds in place being an inexperience pie baker -but you probably won't have too if you bake pies regularly.  So, Dear Opel - I loved your pie and so did my husband.  I will make it again for sure! 
Patti

text:
I'm not a big fan of apple pie but my husband is.  So after 31 years of marriage I decided to make him one.  I'm not a pie baker - but this is EASY and The Best apple pie I've ever tasted.  I did add cinnamon and also sprinkled the top with cinnamon and sugar as my husband likes cinnamon in an apple pie.  If you read Opel's grand-daughter's story - I get the feeling that Opel might have added it too if she had had it on hand the day she created it.  for this first attempt I did not make the lattice top - but after watching the video of how to do that - I will do it next time I make it.  This time I just put a regular top crust on it - poking holes in the top to let out steam.  And because of this I had to mix the sugar and butter mixture into the apples before putting them into the pie.  I baked it exactly as Opel instructed (adding some tinfoil around the edges to keep them from getting too dark as mine seem to always do if I don't put the foil around the edges - I also tented it with foil the last 1/2 hour as my pies have always gotten dark crusts if I don't).  You can see that I have to put some safe-holds in place being an inexperience pie baker -but you probably won't have too if you bake pies regularly.  So, Dear Opel - I loved your pie and so did my husband.  I will make it again for sure! 
Patti

It was perfect the best recipe I've found!

country:

text:
This was my first attempt at making an apple pie.  I made a flaky crust from scratch which was a little challenging.  I thought I messed up this pie but I was so wrong.  Even with my not-so-pretty crust, this pie was sooo delicious.  Two points with this recipe:  doing a lattice is a must as you pour the caramel sauce all over the assembled pie, and this will bubble over so be sure to have something underneath to catch the mess while it's baking.  Follow this recipe the first time as you would probably be pleasantly surprised it doesn't need cinnamon or any other spices.

This was my first attempt at making an apple pie.  I made a flaky crust from scratch which was a little challenging.  I thought I messed up this pie but I was so wrong.  Even with my not-so-pretty crust, this pie was sooo delicious.  Two points with this recipe:  doing a lattice is a must as you pour the caramel sauce all over the assembled pie, and this will bubble over so be sure to have something underneath to catch the mess while it's baking.  Follow this recipe the first time as you would probably be pleasantly surprised it doesn't need cinnamon or any other spices.

text:
I have made this pie several times over the last few years. I found it a bit tart the first time so I have since changed the apples since we don't like granny smith's all that much. I use 3 Braeburn and 3 Fuji and I do add cinnamon to the apple slices and toss it around a bit. I also don't always do the lattice crust. I sometimes make a hole in the center and some designs to get the sugar mixture to flow right in.  Once I used this recipe, and everyone loved it, I have never used another.

text:
This is, by a landslide - the best apple pie around. I only make lattice crust tops for berry pies, so I covered this apple pie with a top crust with apple shaped cut-outs.  For this reason, I poured the sugar/butter mixture over the apples before placing the top crust on.  The apple filling will set once the pie cools.  It's divine.  Add some ice cream or homemade whipped cream and you've got yourself a blue ribbon pie!

text:
FIVE STARS! This pie tasted like my grandmothers and I was almost crying at the first bite! I made this pie for my first ever pie on Thanksgiving for my family in Spain and it was beautiful. I used Ruth's Grandma's pie crust and I was very pleased with the results. This pie was not difficult to make and my family ate it up. I was so happy to make a delish pie from scratch! But yes, be sure to have your pie prepped before pouring the sauce. I made mine with the classic crust on top and before placing it I added the sauce on top of my apples, added the top crust and sealed and then I brushed the top of my pie with an egg wash and then topped it with cinnamon and sugar, baked 45 min at 350 degrees, it was perfectly cooked. :D

Her name should be ***GRANDMA APPLE***this is an awesome recipe...I just finished a pie five minutes ago...I eat the thing by myself in three days..i eat it for breakfast..heat it up with some vanilla ice cream and some whipped cream..oh my oh my...and I will say this though..hahahahhaa...I had to add some cornstarch to prevent it from being too watery..but that depends on the type of apples you use...ive tried this recipe with granny smiths...red delicious..thats the watery apple and gala apples..i used this recipe for the base of every apple pie I bake...theyre all great..THIS IS THE ONLY RECIPE I USE..AND I DONT EVEN NEED TO LOOK AT IT ANYMORE...I have one suggestion...save a little bit of the sauce in the pan and let it cool..it becomes gooey and yuhuhummy...like candy....well im gonna go slice me up a piece..i would add a photo but the pies gone.....thanks grandma...

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Hands down the best apple pie! I am not big into cooking or winging recipes. We went apple picking so I needed something to do with the apples. I have made 2 of these pies in one week. I followed the directions with the exception of brushing the bottom crust with an egg. I followed another reviewer by adding cinnamon but only 2 teaspoons. I added it to the apples rather than the mixture. The lattice crust makes for a great presentation! I poured most of the mixture over the apples, assembled the lattice pieces and poured the rest of the mixture over the top so it still was caramelized. I did have to put a pan under it to catch the drippings. I made my own pie crust from Ruth's Grandma's Pie Crust recipe and my family and friends go nuts over this! Thank you!!!

text:
We have made 10 times, my kids love to help make it; to save time (it takes us 20 min. to get into the oven) we buy a pillsbury crust & just lay the lattice crust horizontally, then vertical. My 7 & 9 year olds do this part, instead of weaving the lattice. Buying a $25 apple peeler/corer/cutter on amazon has saved me 40 minutes of prepping the apples by hand, and my kids love to crank the machine. We also add cinnamon/vanilla. Thank you for this fabulous recipe, we LOVE the caramel sauce baked on top of the crust!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674163.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This delicious apple pie absolutely must be tried at least once without changing a thing.  I know, I know, everyone *knows* that cinnamon is a must in apple pie.  It's not.  The butter based caramel sauce highlights the tartness of the apples perfectly and simply, without addition of other flavors or complications.  Pouring it over the already latticed-top gives a sweet coating to the crust that lends a crunchy contrast to the soft apple filling, as well as making it beautiful when it comes out of the oven.  If you use a deep dish pie plate, there is no bubbled over caramel and 8 apples fit exactly.  My husband, normally a cinnamon lover, loved the pie as it was, and commented that adding cinnamon would probably detract.  My only regret in making this pie is that I forgot to take a picture before serving it.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2013-07-07T12:19:14.763

This delicious apple pie absolutely must be tried at least once without changing a thing.  I know, I know, everyone *knows* that cinnamon is a must in apple pie.  It's not.  The butter based caramel sauce highlights the tartness of the apples perfectly and simply, without addition of other flavors or complications.  Pouring it over the already latticed-top gives a sweet coating to the crust that lends a crunchy contrast to the soft apple filling, as well as making it beautiful when it comes out of the oven. text:
Amazing! This is my second time making this pie and it was even better this time! Last time the bottom crust was a bit undercooked and the glazed lattice got slightly burnt.  This time I did everything according to directions again, except placed the pie one rack lower in the oven. By using the rack one below the middle, the bottom crust was completely cooked and the top was nicely browned! Incredible tasting! A new family favorite!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
With the suggestions from other bakers it made one incredible pie! I added 1 tsp of cinnamon, 1/2 tsp of nutmeg, 1 tbsp of vanilla (minus 1 tbsp of water) , substituted 1 tsbp of flour for cornstatch and 6 red delicious apples. Definitely cut the lattice ahead of time and chill in fridge or freezer while you make the rest. I also soaked all the apples in the mixture before pouring into the crust then made another 1/2 batch of the mixture for the topping. When the pie had 20 min left, I then poured it over the top for a nice Carmelized lattice. I cooked it for 50 min at 350. This pie was a huge hit!!!

With the suggestions from other bakers it made one incredible pie! city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was the first pie I've ever made (I'm an experienced baker in other areas though) and it was delicious.  I cut back on the sugar since I didn't want it to be overwhelmingly sweet, but otherwise I followed the recipe.  Ended up using 6 apples (3 Granny Smith, 3 Red Delicious) and a 9" glass pie dish.  I tossed the apples with all the caramel before putting them in the pie b/c I didn't do a lattice top (just brushed the top crust with heavy cream). I used Martha Stewart's Basic Pie Dough recipe for the crust.  Definitely put it on a cookie sheet in the oven b/c it WILL bubble over.  Everyone loved it at Thanksgiving.  Will make it again next year!

country:

text:
I must say that after reading many reviews I was VERY tempted to alter this recipe.  But I do feel that a recipe should be tried AS IS at least the first time, then be open to tweek and modify as per your taste.  I was very pleased with this pie.  It was very tasty, but in my opinion tastes better hot/warm than cold/room temp.  Next time I'll crimp the edges after I pour the mix on top so it doesn't pool onto parts of the crust.  It makes for a more 'perfect' presentation.  Also, I don't feel the cinnamon or vanilla was missed.  After all that's what a Dutch Apple Pie is for.  Would have given it 5 stars but apple pie isn't really in my top 5 desserts.

text:
I've never written about a recipe before---even if they were really good. BUT this is HANDS DOWN the best apple pie ever!!!!!! I usually read some reviews before making a recipe so I took the advice of another contributor to add cinnamon to the apples -- I also added fresh grated nutmeg to the apples as well. I used apple cider instead of water. I can't wait to make this pie for every occasion!
Next time I think I will pour the mixture over the apples before placing the top crust as someone else suggested and then basting the crust with some reserved mixture.
I can't say enough about this recipe. Thank you grandma Ople and thank you for sharing this recipe.

text:
I used this recipe to make my first pie - it was gooood but I did make some alterations for my second pie.
The amount of sauce made using this recipe I found was way too much.  First pie was oozing sauce and I found it to be too much; for the second pie I halved the butter, white sugar, brown sugar and found this to be much more enjoyable as the apples still had texture and weren't drown in  sauce.

text:
This is an awesome pie! I did what other suggested: brushed egg whites on the bottom crust, I only used 6 Granny Smith Apples (but could have gotten away with just 5 because my pie was super mounded!), added 1 tsp of cinnamon to the apples before pouring them into the bottom crust. The thing that took the longest was the lattice top, but it made the pie so yummy it's a total MUST.

text:
BEST apple pie I have ever had, and it was my first time ever making one! I added cinnamon (eyeballed it), replaced 1T water with 1T vanilla extract, and used a full crust for the top (also coated the bottom crust in egg white as was suggested on here) instead of lattice. I then poured the last bit of caramely goodness I saved over the top crust. This pie was AMAZING. I used Glen Seedling apples and they were absolutely PERFECT.

text:
I am not an apple pie fan at all but when my daughter and grandchildren thought it would be nice to pick grandma a bag of apples while at the u-pick, I had to hunt for something to use up those apples and quick.  I came across this recipe and it is sooo good that my 28 yr old daughter requested me to leave some sugar butter sauce in the pot for her scrape....she's pregnant.  The sauce is what makes this pie so delicious.  It is Awesome, 4 pies later.  Only changes I made, I found it easier to pour the sugar butter sauce before placing on the lattice and received the same results.  For even a more caramel flavor, I added 4 caramels to the sauce.  Also, the tips in the footnotes were great! Thank you so much for sharing.

text:
This apple pie was the best I've ever tasted!  The only problem I had was the filling was a little runny.  I used Honeycrisp apples, which might have been the culprit.  Anyway, it was yummy!  I added 1 t.  of cinnamon and 1/2 t nutmeg to the apples.  I've never made a lattice work crust.  I was surprised how easy it was and how great it looked. I used the basic flaky crust on this website.  Enjoy!

text:
This is a great recipe!  A very different technique then the way I usually make apple pie  so I was curious to try it.  After reading some of the reviews  I realized the recipe doesnt call for cinnamon or nutmeg.  I personally like cinnamon and nutmeg in an apple pie so I did add some to the apples before putting them in the pie dish.  However, I have met people that dont like cinnamon at all  so I think that is just personal preference.  Other then that  I made the recipe exactly.. and it turned out really great.

text:
Wonderful pie! I like apple pie but this was over the top with great and interesting flavors. You should try this recipe at least once as its written before you add anything "extras" to it. I didn't do the lattice top as I was using the "Never Fail Pie Crust II" from this site. It was too soft to try the pretty crust. I'll just have to learn to make a "real" pie crust! **UDATE** 11/8/11 Made this recipe again using the "Flaky Food Processor Pie Crust" recipe from this site. What a wonderful recipe to work with! Pairing these two recipes move this apple pie to more than 5 Star status for me. Made the pie taste better with a crust that was as good as or better than many bakeries!!

text:
Wonderful pie! I like apple pie but this was over the top with great and interesting flavors. You should try this recipe at least once as its written before you add anything "extras" to it. I didn't do the lattice top as I was using the "Never Fail Pie Crust II" from this site. It was too soft to try the pretty crust. I'll just have to learn to make a "real" pie crust! **UDATE** 11/8/11 Made this recipe again using the "Flaky Food Processor Pie Crust" recipe from this site. What a wonderful recipe to work with! Pairing these two recipes move this apple pie to more than 5 Star status for me. Made the pie taste better with a crust that was as good as or better than many bakeries!!

text:
WOW!!   I used a combo of Granny Smiths and Pink Ladys and added a teaspoon of cinnamon and mixed the syrup with the apples.  I cheated on the crust (didn't lattice it) and used Pillsbury refrigerated crusts (heck, it's flaky, tasty and doesn't messy the kitchen).   I've been using my old recipe for decades.  I tried this recipe to find out what the fuss was about.  THIS is my new apple pie recipe.  Thanks so much for sharing it.  YUM YUM YUMMY!!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/49.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Boy, has it been a long time since I have made a homemade apple pie! This recipe turned out wonderfully! I used the Best Ever Pie Crust recipe from this site. A couple of things to note: I do agree with the previous review that there was no "paste" consistency with the flour/butter mixture.  The syrup had a great caramel like flavor (which I poured on the pie before I put on the top crust- did not make lattice top.) I also agree that spices are needed but love the suggestion to coat the apples with the spice, not to mix it into the syrup. And finally, 8 granny smith apples will make for a *tart* pie which is great if that's what you want. I prefer sweeter pies so I used 2 granny smith, 2 gala and 2 golden delicious. Turned out to be a great combination although I still had apples left over, so next time I will cut back to 5 apples. I used a stone pie plate and it was beautifully cooked in about 40 minutes. I will make this one again!

text:
WOW. This pie is fantastic.  I read the reviews before I made it and added 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon to the apples. Honestly, it probably would have been perfect without the cinnamon. I also used a combination of granny smiths and galas (to cut some of the tartness).  I didn't do the lattice - instead, I put vent slits in the top pie crust and brushed on 2 tbs of the butter/sugar mixture that I had reserved.  Served it a-la-mode and it was a hit!

text:
I thought this apple pie was very good although I did make some changes based on other reviews and the fact that my husband requested cinnamon in the pie.  I used Jonathon apples, salted butter, and added about 3/4 teaspoon of cinnamon and vanilla to the sauce however, after reading reviews I may add the cinnamon directly to the apples next time.  This is my first attempt at apple pie and was a success but, since I have no other apple pie recipes to compare it to I am temporarily giving it a 4* with the possibility of a future 5*.  I'm sure the pie is equally as good without the cinnamon and vanilla.  The reason I believe this is because I have made apple dumplings with no or little cinnamon and they are wonderful too.  I will be making this again.

text:
Not like this recipe needs anymore reviews but I loved it so much I could not resist! I did what other reviewers suggested, added 1 tbsp of vanilla extract and mixed 1 Tbsp of cinnamon onto my apples then poured the caramel syrup over them before dumping into the pie plate. I baked it on the bottom shelf of my oven uncovered for the first 10 minutes and then covered the edges with aluminum foil.

text:
This was an excellent pie.  The sugar to apples ratio is perfect.  Like other reviewers I added a tsp of cinnamon. I took this pie to a dinner party and it was a big hit. The other thing I changed is I add the syrup mixture to the apples instead of pouring it through the lattice mixture because I don't like the effect that has on the look of the pastry.

text:
If you are on the fence about trying this recipe, JUST DO IT! I know that very idea of making an apple pie without cinnamon, nutmeg or vanilla - UNIMAGINABLE - but, it is fabulous. Put in a new oven liner and don't expect to use it again cause this pie can drip a little since you are pouring the "caramel" on top. But, despite that one minor detail, everyone I have made this pie for loves it and loves me for making it - I have made this pie over forty times. Grandma Ople was nothing short of a cooking legacy I am certain :) Thanks for sharing her gift with me!

text:
If you are on the fence about trying this recipe, JUST DO IT! I know that very idea of making an apple pie without cinnamon, nutmeg or vanilla - UNIMAGINABLE - but, it is fabulous. Put in a new oven liner and don't expect to use it again cause this pie can drip a little since you are pouring the "caramel" on top. But, despite that one minor detail, everyone I have made this pie for loves it and loves me for making it - I have made this pie over forty times. Grandma Ople was nothing short of a cooking legacy I am certain :) Thanks for sharing her gift with me!

text:
This is the only apple pie recipe I use any more. My husband, who hates apple pie, LOVES this pie. I sold one of these through my sister's gift boutique and the buyer ordered 15 more as groom's "cake" for her son's wedding! The only thing I do differently is that I toss the apples with a teaspoon of cinnamon before arranging them in the dish. But it tastes good without the cinnamon as well. You can't go wrong with this pie!

text:
I MUST tell you MY little secret that was "the frosting on the cake" for this pie:  I used 1/4 cup of CAPTAIN MORGAN'S SPICED RUM instead of the water (you can still use a little water [I didn't] but definitely use a full 1/4 cup of CM) ... it was DIVINE!!!  I tossed the apples in half of the mix and poured the rest through the lattice crust ... I made this for Thanksgiving and a few of us ate a piece while waiting for the turkey to be done (we couldn't wait)... I was asked to make it again for Christmas and was SO elated because I forgot to take some home with me on Thanksgiving ...

Yummy :) Besides adding a Tbs. cinnamon to the apples, I followed this recipe exactly. I poured the yummy caramel sauce slowly over the pie using a small gravy ladle, carefully filling in the little holes between the lattice work and letting it dribble slowly onto the crust. I had to bake mine a bit longer than the recipe stated to get my apples more tender but I just covered the top with foil so the crust wouldn't burn. Thanks for posting, I'll make it again!

Display Name:
Dani4a

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/76798.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wow!  My mother never made apple pie like this, so it was a pretty revolutionary recipe to me.  I used the flaky crust recipe from allrecipes, and it was great.  With the actual apple pie recipe, I made a couple alterations.  I sugared the apples first so that they wouldn't fall after getting into the over (giving us a nice gap between filling and top crust).  Alton Brown trick.  We love Alton Brown.  Anyway, I then added that juice to the sauce, giving it a bit of apple flavor.  I also added a little of my mother's homemade apple butter, again to add a bit more flavor.  Finally, I realized partway through that I didn't have any brown sugar.  So instead, I used half white sugar and half honey.  This gave it a beautiful color and helped out the caramely texture.  The sauce alone was beautiful and tasty.  The pie is absolutely amazing!  Turned out very well for my first attempt at making an apple pie.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2008-08-19T12:04:38.807
helpfulCount:
1

text:
Wow!  My mother never made apple pie like this, so it was a pretty revolutionary recipe to me.  I used the flaky crust recipe from allrecipes, and it was great.  With the actual apple pie recipe, I made a couple alterations.  I sugared the apples first so that they wouldn't fall after getting into the over (giving us a nice gap between filling and top crust).  Alton Brown trick.  We love Alton Brown.  Anyway, I then added that juice to the sauce, giving it a bit of apple flavor.  I also added a little of my mother's homemade apple butter, again to add a bit more flavor.  Finally, I realized partway through that I didn't have any brown sugar.  So instead, I used half white sugar and half honey.  This gave it a beautiful color and helped out the caramely texture.  The sauce alone was beautiful and tasty.  The pie is absolutely amazing!  Turned out very well for my first attempt at making an apple pie.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is simply wonderful and I found it very easy to make. I made my own pie crust and then followed the recipe exactly-- I didn't add or take away anything at all. It turned out amazingly. One guest said that my pie was the freshest tasting pie he ever had. I think this is because the sweetener is poured on top instead of as filling. The cooked apples were mildly sweetened by the sugars that melted in through the lattice top and they seemed to be bursting with fresh apple pie flavor. The sugar/butter mix on the lattice top caramelized in baking and was deliciously crispy with fresh crust, warm apples and cold, cold vanilla ice cream.

This recipe is simply wonderful and I found it very easy to make. I made my own pie crust and then followed the recipe exactly-- I didn't add or take away anything at all. It turned out amazingly. One guest said that my pie was the freshest tasting pie he ever had. I think this is because the sweetener is poured on top instead of as filling. The cooked apples were mildly sweetened by the sugars that melted in through the lattice top and they seemed to be bursting with fresh apple pie flavor. The sugar/butter mix on the lattice top caramelized in baking and was deliciously crispy with fresh crust, warm apples and cold, cold vanilla ice cream.

text:
I was a pie virgin and this great recipe was easy enough for me to be proud of my results. I did slightly edit the recipe (shaved off some butter, added some spices, used double the syrup, vanilla and Empire apples) and baked a little longer than 45min. As someone suggested I mixed the apples with  3/4 of the syrup mixture and then added it to the crust. I used the rest to glaze the top of the pie a few minutes before it was done. I made it on a whim one day for my family and everyone loved it. My sister actually refused to leave until I cut it. Thanks for sharing a little of Grandma Ople's legacy with us.

text:
I was a pie virgin and this great recipe was easy enough for me to be proud of my results. I did slightly edit the recipe (shaved off some butter, added some spices, used double the syrup, vanilla and Empire apples) and baked a little longer than 45min. As someone suggested I mixed the apples with  3/4 of the syrup mixture and then added it to the crust. I used the rest to glaze the top of the pie a few minutes before it was done. I made it on a whim one day for my family and everyone loved it. My sister actually refused to leave until I cut it. Thanks for sharing a little of Grandma Ople's legacy with us.

text:
Wonderful!  I used 2 ready-made crusts (hard to make the lattice top, but worked well enough) 6 honey crisp apples and 6 Tablespoons of flour because my butter and 3 TBL of flour weren't making a sticky paste. This recipe made the most wonderful tasting crust and perfectly textured, non-runny apple pie. I'm not much of an apple pie fan but my boys wanted to make apple pie. Now I want to eat the whole pie up!! It's even better on day 2!

text:
Wonderful!  I used 2 ready-made crusts (hard to make the lattice top, but worked well enough) 6 honey crisp apples and 6 Tablespoons of flour because my butter and 3 TBL of flour weren't making a sticky paste. This recipe made the most wonderful tasting crust and perfectly textured, non-runny apple pie. I'm not much of an apple pie fan but my boys wanted to make apple pie. Now I want to eat the whole pie up!! It's even better on day 2!

I LOVE this pie. I usually make this exactly as directed.  Pouring the yummy liquid on the top not only gives you a beautiful looking pie, but the crust tastes absolutely wonderful (coming from a person who typically will eat everything BUT the crust!). I actually prefer no cinnamon in this pie, but will oftentimes make my own cinnamon ice cream (recipe is on this site), and it goes perfectly together!  I will make this pie even when apples aren't in season - it's totally worth it. Thanks for sharing!

this was good - i thought it would be a little more caramelly though. i added cinnamon and some corn starch to the apples - i added some vanilla to the sauce - my apples were so thick that the sauce didn't run all the way through so next time i would try to mix the sauce with the apples. i thought i had too many apples but they cooked down quite a bit. i baked the crust for 10 mins brushed with egg whites and it was perfect. i used a full crust on the top brushed with egg whites and sprinkled with sugar. it looked very pretty when done.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
mmm tasty. I did however take the advice of others and make some changes. I only used 6 granny smith apples cut up in difference sizes. I also added 2 tsp cinnamon and fresh nutmeg. Also dusted the apples w/ some cornstarch and cinnamon. I made my own crust (which makes a huuuge difference!) and cut back on the sugar a bit. Also be very careful to not overcook the sauce/syrup mixture as I overcooked it the first time and the sugars separated from the butter so I had to throw it out and redo it!. The pie was great! thank you

This pie was absolutly great!!! This made my "hard to please" family begging for more!! But what made it great for me was I accidently left the butter on the stove till it got dark brown. text:
I did like this pie, I thought the taste was good.  I did make some changes.  I did add some cinnamon to it, also a little vanilla extract.  I followed the advice of others, instead of pouring all of the mixture on top of the pie, I did mix the apples in about half of the mix, then poured the rest over the top.  My pie did come out a little runny, although I did add some extra flour.  It tasted pretty good warm with some homemade vanilla ice cream!

I wish I could give this more stars!  What a wonderful recipe.  I love making apple pie but everytime I do it is a bit too runny no matter what modifications I make.  This one however sets like store bought but tastes like what my grandma used to make.  I also added 1 teas. each of cinnamon and nutmeg to the apples before putting the latice on top.  The presentation is perfect and the taste is even better. I will be making this plenty of times before Thanksgiving!  The best allrecipes dessert recipe by far!

text:
This is a wonderful apple pie.  My daughters and I have made it many times now and it is always wonderful and easy.  We use ready made pie crust and make a lattice crust on top.  We pour most of the syrup on before we put the crust on -- then put the crust on -- then pour a little of the syrup over the crust.  We made this all the time -- it is easy and always comes out perfect. It looks beautiful too!

I made this for my parents.  Before tasting it my mother said, "I'm sorry, but without cinammon, it is not going to be apple pie."  She soon found herself eating her words, as well as my pie.  My dad couldn't get enough.  I will still make your typical apple pie(occassionaly); however, I will definitely make this again and again, because it was so easy.  You can memorize this recipe; it is so simple.  With a ready made crust and the use of a apple/corer/slicer,  I can have this oven ready in ten minutes.  Thank you for an excellent recipe.

Anyway, I'd still recommend this recipe on taste alone, and I'll definately try it again.

userID:

Display Name:
Jamie Danjoint
isPro:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I ventured out and made my first scratch made apple pie last night (crust is store bought). Words cant describe the deliciousness of this #applepie. Its not a traditional apple pie because it doesnt have cinnamon or any of those spices. Its just good ol granny smith apples, butter, flour, sugar, brown sugar and water. I almost altered the recipe, but Im so glad I didnt! I figured if Grandma Ople perfected then it who am I to alter?! You know what I love about this recipe? Its all about the apples! By not having cinnamon or the other spices, you taste the tartness of the granny smith apples, but the sugar and brown sugar balance it so well that its that perfect balance of tart and sweet. The flaky crust gives it a bit of crunch. Then take it over the top with a scoop (or 2...) of Breyers Natural Vanilla ice cream that slowly melts as it sits on a heap of freshly sliced, warm apple pie!!! My goodness, I woke up this morning thinking about this pie and how I can justify having a slice for breakfast! Do yourself a favor and make this recipe unaltered at least once to truly appreciate the amazingness if this recipe. I was a pinch away from adding just a bit of cinnamon, but I felt like I was disrespecting Grandma Ople by at least not trying it once unaltered! Im SO GLAD I didnt veer off Grandma Oples apple pie path! My husband and I were beyond shocked that I made something that looked and tasted like an award-winning pie! THANK YOU GRANDMA OPLE!!!

Made it exactly as described (sprinkled some cinnamon on dry cut apples) placed dry apples in crust did lattice top and then made the sauce last- the entire time I was making sauce questioning everything about it as at first it was runny not paste but then I added water and somehow THE WATER made this work? I threw my faith into the recipe and gramma opal and just went for it thinking if I need to change it next time I will! Well no need to change it believe me the sauce mixes in with apples juice as its bubbling and cooking and honest to Pete its perfect ! Let it cool completely if you can wait that long :) top was crunchy and inside was Carmely lol I used salted butter because thats what I had and it was amazing -

city:

country:
None
text:
Ive made this about five times now and Ill never get tired of having a fat slice with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream. I adopted some suggestions made by other users: toss your sliced, peeled apples (I use 5-6 gala apples for a 9-inch pie) in 1tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1 tsp vanilla extract. Add the caramel sauce to the apples and mix to coat apples evenly before adding it to your pie crust (Pillsbury pre-made crust is pretty bomb and it saves so much time). Lattice the top crust to make it look legit and then bake at 350F, middle rack for 50 min. Be sure to use a baking sheet underneath to catch any overflow. Enjoy!

text:
I sprinkled cinnamon on the apples, added a tsp of vanilla extract to the sauce as well as a very tiny pinch of salt. I made the sauce and poured it over the lattice and cooked for the initial high temp bake and I got worried it wouldn't be enough to cover the apples so I made another batch of sauce scaled to 6tbsp butter and poured that over. My apples weren't as tender as I wanted when the time was up but the crust had good color so I turned the heat down to 300 and baked an extra 20 mins. Exquisite!

text:
Holy smokes, Grandma Ople knows her stuff. This pie is delicious!!!! I think this is the best apple pie Ive ever had. I stuck pretty close to the recipe with the exception of adding some sauce to the apples before putting the lattice top on and adding the rest. I didnt count apples, just added until the pie plate was heaping full - I used a bag of small/med green apples. No cinnamon or other spices were added and its absolutely perfect. Like others have said the sauce on top becomes kind of caramelized and its fantastic. I will recommend this to anyone and everyone. Make this pie! You will not regret it.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/7356695.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the best apple pie I've ever made!  And maybe ever eaten!  Before I tried this recipe, the last few times I made apple pie, I have been super disappointed with those recipes to the point that I thought maybe I just didn't like apple pie anymore.  It seemed like the sugar didn't really melt and make that gooey decadent filling that I wanted.  So I got to wondering if it would work to melt the sugar into a sauce to pour on the apples.  I was so happy to find this recipe that did just that!!  I added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon because I like that flavor for apple pie as well as a pinch of salt.  Also, I just poured the syrup on the apples and then put the top crust on without doing the lattice work due to limited time.  It was definitely 5 star and it wasn't just a fluke.  I've made it twice now and it was fabulous both times.
Review:

5

userID:

Display Name:
Candace Chang

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/4240143.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Hands down the best pie ever. My whole family loved it, my boyfriend said it saved Thanksgiving, and it was so much better than store bought. I made it pretty much exactly as the recipe called for, couldn't believe 8 apples could fit into one 9 inch pan.  The only difference I made was tossing the apples with a little bit of the caramel sauce before pouring them in, covering the pie with the lattice, and then pouring the rest of the sauce on top and basting it over the top crust. Protip, make the sauce after making the lattice so that you can pour it immediately into/onto the pie, it cools off and hardens quickly! 

We'll be eating it again for Christmas.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2017-11-24T10:58:53.733

text:
I am 75 years old and have baked pies most of my life.  this is the apple pie recipe I use.  I've made it many times.  I pour the butter/sugar mixture over my apples before putting the top crust on, not because it's the best way to do it, only because it's easiest for me.  I'm always asked to bring this pie whenever we have family/friend get-togethers.  (I also add a tsp of cinnamon, just because we like it).  Thank you Grandma Ople.

text:
The pie looked remarkably good.  Compared to my usual apple pie recipe, which is a basic 2 crust pie with spices, I thought Grandma  O's pie was good, but didn't measure up to my standard.  The pie was very liquidy and although I cut the apple slices rather thin, it was not cooked through and the apples were still too firm after following the instructed length of baking time.    I'd like to try this pie again using less water to see if that changes anything.  Honestly, it's the first time I've ever added WATER to an apple pie.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
this recipe was very easy to follow and the final result was absolutely amazing. I followed the instructions given for the most part, with a few variations. the first time I made it, adding the sauce over the crust made it sag a little, so for the second pie I alternated between layers of apples and sauce and put the crust on top at the end. I also added a little nutmeg and cinnamon. 
and to the reviewer who complained about the sauce being ruined once it cooled, I found that all you had to do to return it to its liquid consistency was to add a little more water and let it simmer for a bit, stirring regularly.

text:
this recipe was very easy to follow and the final result was absolutely amazing. I followed the instructions given for the most part, with a few variations. the first time I made it, adding the sauce over the crust made it sag a little, so for the second pie I alternated between layers of apples and sauce and put the crust on top at the end. I also added a little nutmeg and cinnamon. 
and to the reviewer who complained about the sauce being ruined once it cooled, I found that all you had to do to return it to its liquid consistency was to add a little more water and let it simmer for a bit, stirring regularly.

I have made this recipe for years now and now my daughters are using it. We sometimes add cinnamon or just change it a bit for a switch but it is the BEST Apple pie EVER! I have had to add more flour and one of my daughters adds more sugar depending on the type of apple she is using. You always have to take into account that the apples themselves have liquid so may need to adjust. I wouldn't bother trying any other apple pie recipe as this one is the favorite of all I have tried.

None
text:
This was an amazingly delicious and easy to bake pie. It will become part of my repertoire, as my husband loves apple pie and this recipe is much better than the frozen Marie Callender pie he usually gets. I did make some changes, of course, after reading other reviews.  I added a tsp. of cinnamon, 1/4 tsp. nutmeg, 1 tsp. vanilla and two extra Tbsp. of flour.  I made sure to cook the flour long enough so it lost its taste when making the roux. Other than that, I followed the recipe. Oh! I only had Gala apples on hand, so that's what I used. I am sure it would have been quite tasty without the changes, but I never quite follow any recipe ;)

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Love this simple recipe. I did change the flour to 3 1/2 Tbs and added 1 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp nutmeg. I was too lazy to make lattice crust.  So, before I top crusted the pie, I poured the sugar mixture over the apples, reserving a little. I put the top crust on and brushed the remaining mixture on top. Cut slits in it and popped it in the oven! It was amazing. I do recommend you use Granny Smith apples. I made it twice. First time I used Macouns. It came out delish but a bit mushy. Second time I used Granny Smith (Do NOT slice them too thin.)...PERFECTION!

text:
Love this simple recipe. I did change the flour to 3 1/2 Tbs and added 1 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp nutmeg. I was too lazy to make lattice crust.  So, before I top crusted the pie, I poured the sugar mixture over the apples, reserving a little. I put the top crust on and brushed the remaining mixture on top. Cut slits in it and popped it in the oven! It was amazing. I do recommend you use Granny Smith apples. I made it twice. First time I used Macouns. It came out delish but a bit mushy. Second time I used Granny Smith (Do NOT slice them too thin.)...PERFECTION!

text:
Excellent apple pie recipe. I've used the same recipe for years but after making this one, I will be switching! Based on recommendations, I added a tsp. of cinnamon and vanilla to the sauce. It was perfect - just the right amount. I also mixed 2/3 of the sauce with the apples prior to putting them in the pie. Then I spread the rest of the glaze over the top crust. Absolutely delicious!

text:
I made this yesterday after my kids had an apple picking field trip.  I have only made apple pie a few times and have never really been satisfied with the results, but this one was wonderful!  My husband took one bite and said it was the best apple pie I ever made.  I was a little skeptical about the sauce and pouring it over the lattice, but it gave the lattice an almost candy coated taste that was amazing. I was also worried about no cinnamon in the recipe, but the sauce was delicious with the brown sugar.  I will definitely make this one again!

Really good!  I would use aluminum foil since my pie started to get pretty dark.  I need to say I used all macintosh apples vs granny smith. It did not come out mushy but it was too sweet. Cut back the sugar if not using tart apples!  Next time I'll use granny smith's.

text:
This is the same recipe as the 'Apple Pie by Grandma Ople' on this site, so to repeat what I said in that review...this is delicious and beautiful! I added in about 1 teaspoon cinnamon and combined the sugar mixture with the apples instead of waiting to put it on top, which worked out nicely. I do think, at least in my oven, it needs to be cooked longer. I sliced my apples really thin and they still were a bit on the hard/chewy side, so make note of that. Other than that, this is a great pie recipe and one I will be using again and again~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)

text:
Today was the third time making this pie and there is nothing better.  I made a few minor additions you may want to try. I added about a tspn of cinnamon, half cup of walnuts, the zest from one lemon and the juice from half a lemon to the apple mixture.  Also used only brown sugar and pored the majority of the syrup mixture on the apples before adding the lattice strips.6 or 7 apples is enough.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This makes a great pie and it's easy to put together, BUT,  I made changes.  I added 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice to the cooked mixture before pouring on.  I had to cook it for 60 minutes at 350  degrees F to completely soften the Granny Smith apples.  I know my oven is accurate as i use an oven thermometer, so I personally think the heat should be increased to 400 degrees F to bake it in 45 minutes.  You will have to cover the pie edges with aluminum foil and tent the middle to prevent over-browning the top crust.  Good plan, horrible execution.
Review:
Rating:
3
dateLastModified:
2017-01-03T21:26:21.19

This makes a great pie and it's easy to put together, BUT,  I made changes.  I added 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice to the cooked mixture before pouring on.  I had to cook it for 60 minutes at 350  degrees F to completely soften the Granny Smith apples.  I know my oven is accurate as i use an oven thermometer, so I personally think the heat should be increased to 400 degrees F to bake it in 45 minutes.  You will have to cover the pie edges with aluminum foil and tent the middle to prevent over-browning the top crust.  Good plan, horrible execution.

userID:

Display Name:
ChiBayBee
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674137.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this pie twice now and it tastes great. My number one piece of advice to avoid a disaster - as I had with my second attempt is to not overcook the sauce. On my first try, I made the lattice in advance and mixed the sauce with the apples, and saved some to pour over. The second time, I followed the recipe exactly. I would not recommend working on the lattice while the sauce simmers. It cannot simmer unattended and really only needs to just barely thicken. My was too thick and wouldn't penetrate the crust. I had to scrape it off (looked ugly and ruined my lattice). Then I made a new sauce, stirring constantly at a low flame for 5 minutes, and poured that into holes I made in the top. Good luck! It's definitely worth a try with some precautions.
Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2016-11-12T15:34:14.037
helpfulCount:
0

text:
I've made this pie twice now and it tastes great. My number one piece of advice to avoid a disaster - as I had with my second attempt is to not overcook the sauce. On my first try, I made the lattice in advance and mixed the sauce with the apples, and saved some to pour over. The second time, I followed the recipe exactly. I would not recommend working on the lattice while the sauce simmers. It cannot simmer unattended and really only needs to just barely thicken. My was too thick and wouldn't penetrate the crust. I had to scrape it off (looked ugly and ruined my lattice). Then I made a new sauce, stirring constantly at a low flame for 5 minutes, and poured that into holes I made in the top. Good luck! It's definitely worth a try with some precautions.

text:
I poured 1/2 the sauce directly on top of  the apples rather than try to drizzle through the holes.  The other half I poured on top but it slid off and burned onto the parchment paper line cookie sheet I placed the pie on in the oven.  The burning sugar  made the house smell bad.  Next time I'll try 3/4 in and only 1/4 on top.  At the point of turning the oven down, I removed the parchment and there were no more drips.  Tasted great.  My guests loved it

text:
I've been making this Apple Pie for over 8 years. It's always turning out good. Granny Smith is not available where I'm living, and always use Fuji Apples. Fuji's texture is perfect and I also add 1 tsp of cinnamon, 1-2 TBS of Rum during making caramel. Rum makes the taste more gorgeous. To save time, I use "ready to bake"- frozen pie shell and sheets from the supermarket.

text:
I went through the recipe following the instructions, and went back to make sure I got everything.  WHERE IS THE CINNAMON AND NUTMEG? You can't make apple pie without cinnamon and nutmeg. Don't worry. I fixed it. 1 tsp of cinnamon, 1/2 tsp of nutmeg and 1/4 tsp of ground cloves. I also brushed the top crust with egg wash and sprinkled it with cinnamon-sugar.  You can fix the recipe. You're welcome.

userID:
1237075
Display Name:
CMICHE1
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
38
favoritesCount:
413
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677179.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This has become my standard apple pie recipe, with a few changes.  I put the sliced apples in a bowl and toss with a little lemon juice, pour the sugar mixture in, mix and let it sit for a few minutes before pouring into the crust. I don't do the lattice top, just a regular one with slits cut in, brushed with an egg white and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar (like you'd use to make cinnamon toast). I always line a cookie sheet with foil and place the pie on that so it won't spill over into the oven (and the foil keeps it from burning onto the cookie sheet). When turning the heat down after the first 15 minutes, I put a pie shield around the edge of the crust to keep it from over-browning. This pie always gets rave reviews, no need to keep searching for another recipe. This one's a keeper.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2016-08-06T18:11:56.263
helpfulCount:
0

text:
This has become my standard apple pie recipe, with a few changes.  I put the sliced apples in a bowl and toss with a little lemon juice, pour the sugar mixture in, mix and let it sit for a few minutes before pouring into the crust. I don't do the lattice top, just a regular one with slits cut in, brushed with an egg white and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar (like you'd use to make cinnamon toast). I always line a cookie sheet with foil and place the pie on that so it won't spill over into the oven (and the foil keeps it from burning onto the cookie sheet). When turning the heat down after the first 15 minutes, I put a pie shield around the edge of the crust to keep it from over-browning. This pie always gets rave reviews, no need to keep searching for another recipe. This one's a keeper.

text:
I read thru many of the reviews and just decided to make a few tweeks for my preference. Used Pillsbury refrigerated pie crust. Cut the Granny Smith apples thin (1/8") and added 1 tsp of vanilla and 3 tabls of corn starch to the butter mixture. poured it all over the pie crust. Put foil over the  crust after the first 425/15 minutes. And cooked it the full 45 minutes on 350. Turned out great.  Set well.

text:
I read thru many of the reviews and just decided to make a few tweeks for my preference. Used Pillsbury refrigerated pie crust. Cut the Granny Smith apples thin (1/8") and added 1 tsp of vanilla and 3 tabls of corn starch to the butter mixture. poured it all over the pie crust. Put foil over the  crust after the first 425/15 minutes. And cooked it the full 45 minutes on 350. Turned out great.  Set well.

text:
Y-U-M!! This pie is outstanding. I used pillsbury pre made pie crust but will try with homemade crust next time! Tip- just make sure when you are making the sugar filling your butter isn't too hot when you add the flour! It's really important for the flour to incorporate with the butter for a smooth mixture before adding the water and sugars - otherwise you'll end up with an oily, granular mess! Will be making this pie again FOR SURE.

Incredible pie. The best I've ever had. And so easy! I've made this pie 3 times. It's definitely easier to mix the apples with most of the caramel sauce before you put the apples in the pie.  I reserve a little sauce to pour over or brush on the top crust. Also I always add 1 teaspoon of vanilla, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg to the sauce. Ridiculously delicious.

userID:
2418139
Display Name:
kurlyy1
isPro:

101
favoritesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1744814.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Perfection!! Turned out absolutely perfect. I prepared the apple pie filling ahead of time by sauting in a pan in the butter and until fork tender but still retaining shape. Then added sugar and spices (Cinnamon, dash of nutmeg and dash of cloves(, then took off the heat and added apple cider (instead of water since I had it) and lemon juice. I reserved some liquid to pour over the crust. I cooked it about 50 min until crust was finished. Lattice top crust is a must so filling is not too much liquid. It was the best apple pie I ever had! :-) UPDATE: 6 apples seems to work better than 8. There wasn't enough crust to apple ratio for my taste with 8 by a long shot. BOttom crust was not crispy enough...maybe prebake next time? It's been too soupy a few times so next time I will be sure to add more flour or use less liquid. Still delicious though.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-12-29T00:38:13.81
helpfulCount:
0
userID:
2418139
Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1744814.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Perfection!! Turned out absolutely perfect. I prepared the apple pie filling ahead of time by sauting in a pan in the butter and until fork tender but still retaining shape. Then added sugar and spices (Cinnamon, dash of nutmeg and dash of cloves(, then took off the heat and added apple cider (instead of water since I had it) and lemon juice. I reserved some liquid to pour over the crust. I cooked it about 50 min until crust was finished. Lattice top crust is a must so filling is not too much liquid. It was the best apple pie I ever had! :-) UPDATE: 6 apples seems to work better than 8. There wasn't enough crust to apple ratio for my taste with 8 by a long shot. BOttom crust was not crispy enough...maybe prebake next time? It's been too soupy a few times so next time I will be sure to add more flour or use less liquid. Still delicious though.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-12-27T12:49:03.683
helpfulCount:
0

text:
This pie had my family begging for more. It was SO good and SO easy. I used only six apples and that was plenty. I also sautd half of the apples before I put them in the pie. Also, as suggested in a different review, I tossed the apples in cinnamon before baking them. It was amazing! If you're looking for a good apple pie recipe this is it!

userID:
16869454
Display Name:
Kayla
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
0
favoritesCount:
0
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674140.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Ive made this pie a dozen times now and everyone always raves on how good it is.I made a few tweaks however and now I think it is perfect! First I use about 7 large Macintosh apples I'm not a fan of the tart granny Smith's, I peel and cut them, add some lemon toss in cinnamon sugar. While cutting the apples I start the caramel sauce. Make sure to let your rue thicken before adding sugars and water and really let it simmer. If you don't the sauce will become separated. Once it's bubbling and almost coming up over the sides I turn off and let it thicken just a bit. I use betty Crocker pie crust. Place in pie tin, add some egg wash to it this will give you a crispier pie crust. I like to add some cinnamon sugar on it as well. Add apples and pour 3/4 mixture. Then cut top pie crust in strips, brush with egg wash. Lattice the top, add the rest of your sauce and sprinkle some cinnamon sugar. Place pie on baking sheet with some foil or it will overflow in your oven. Mmmh first pie where I actually like the crust. Don't taste the caramel sauce it will burn your tongue, you would think I would learn but I swear I've burnt it five times making this pie! Happy baking!!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-11-25T21:42:37.22
helpfulCount:
0

text:
Ive made this pie a dozen times now and everyone always raves on how good it is.I made a few tweaks however and now I think it is perfect! First I use about 7 large Macintosh apples I'm not a fan of the tart granny Smith's, I peel and cut them, add some lemon toss in cinnamon sugar. While cutting the apples I start the caramel sauce. Make sure to let your rue thicken before adding sugars and water and really let it simmer. If you don't the sauce will become separated. Once it's bubbling and almost coming up over the sides I turn off and let it thicken just a bit. I use betty Crocker pie crust. Place in pie tin, add some egg wash to it this will give you a crispier pie crust. I like to add some cinnamon sugar on it as well. Add apples and pour 3/4 mixture. Then cut top pie crust in strips, brush with egg wash. Lattice the top, add the rest of your sauce and sprinkle some cinnamon sugar. Place pie on baking sheet with some foil or it will overflow in your oven. Mmmh first pie where I actually like the crust. Don't taste the caramel sauce it will burn your tongue, you would think I would learn but I swear I've burnt it five times making this pie! Happy baking!!

None
text:
Last year for Thanksgiving we tried several apple pies. This was our favorite and it is a beautiful pie! We (mostly my 14 year-old son) have made it with and without spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, etc.) both are great, but I am a cinnamon addict so I usually add spices to the apples. 
Other than that the only other change would be my favorite pie crust, but this is an excellent pie! On Christmas Eve last year one guest was full and only wanted a sliver, it was so good he went back for a second larger helping and said "it is healthy, it is just apple salad" so in our house we just call it Apple Salad now and have a large "healthy" piece;)

text:
This is such a great recipe! I have made it multiple times and adding a teaspoon of cinnamon helps take it to the next level! I also tried it alamode. So delicious! I recommend this to everyone who reads this review. When I was making it the first time, I was worried that if I put ONLY G. Smiths in, it would be too tart. I stand corrected. Just the perfect amount of tart. I feel like the sugar kind of helps balance out the flavors pretty darn well. When I took the first bite, I couldn't stop eating it! I ate until I was physically and mentally sick of this apple pie, and yet, I make it again. :) To all of you who are worried that it is too tart, don't sweat it. Follow the recipe ;)

text:
This was my first attempt ever at making a pie.  It turned out perfect.  I added 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp vanilla and 1/2 tsp nutmeg to the apples (per another reviewers recommendation).  I used 8 apples and could have added another one.  I did a homemade crust from a friend's recipe (shortening, flour, salt, ice water).   This pie recipe is solid.  Be sure to prep your apples and crust before making the butter/sugar/flour mixture.  Will definitely make again.

I have made this recipe at least 20 timed bye far the best I have seen,  I tweaked a few things,  instead of using just granny smith apples, being in live in Ny, I mixed them with Empire apples and or Cortland to add significant flavor, after peeling the apples and slicing them I put the apples in water in a bowl  with  cinnamon to soak while I make the crust the apples hold their flavor better with the added cinnamon excellent, easy to make recipe

text:
I can personally attest to this recipe. I get lots of compliments for my baked goods so I know a thing or two but this is by far the BEST apple pie recipe hands down! I do add cinnamon and a touch of nutmeg for that traditional apple pie taste but making a sauce to pour over the apples and lattice is what does it! This is so fantastic. Try it. You won't go back to regular old apple pie every again! I would also like to add that I use my own crust recipe which is a pate brisee. Very simple ingredients and a super pie.

text:
Made this yesterday and it's almost gone......and it's just the two of us!  Had to use my Mom's spices though, can't do a pie without her!  I did mix the apples like others had mentioned. It seems that Granny Smiths don't turn out well for me.  They are a 'hard' apple but always turn to applesauce in a pie. Guess they know this and are out to get me. (Yes, I interact with the fruit.??)  This is a keeper recipe. It will be going to pot luck get togethers. To all of the folks who this did not turn out for don't give up. Here in Florida the humidity is bad on cooking certain things. Make it at least another time. It's worth the effort.

text:
This was just amazing as the reviews say it will be. I did add 1 tsp of cinnamon to the apples and think it's necessary. I also think doing the lattice crust is necessary because the crust then absorbs the sauce which is great. I had no issues with it bubbling over, but I did take a long time to pour the sauce in and let it sink into the apples. I also dusted the top of the freshly baked pie with cinnamon. Great!

It was delicious ! I don't like apple pies but my husband wanted one... So I come upon this recipe. 
I only added a little bit of nutmeg and cinnamon to the apples, and didn't add all of the white sugar it called for. 
As I read in a review before... The sauce might ooze out while its baking. So you might want to put it on top of a baking tray. 
It was soooo good ?? will do again... And again !

text:
Love this recipe!  I know it is recommended to keep the recipe as is, but I love cinnamon so added that and some vanilla.  I reduced the water amount and added a bit more flour to the mixture.  Mixing with the apples and saving a little to pour on top works great.  Then I brushed egg whites on the crust edge and on the top and sprinkled with raw sugar.  Baked for an hour at 350 degrees.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this pie twice.  The first time, I attempted to make a paste from the flour and butter (as the directions state) before I added the sugars.  I got a crazy hard crust, but it tasted pretty good.  The second time, I ended up with like a caramel sauce, which is what I think I was supposed to get.  However, to get enough of it into the lattice, it spilled over onto the cooking sheet I was feeling pretty happy that I placed under the pie plate.  Enough got into the pie, to flavor it, though.  Finally, when I was ready to get my pie on, I cut into it and found a sloppy mess.  It tasted good, don't get me wrong - flavor was good and apples were tender.  But, I gave up trying to cut slices and just scooped it with a spoon.  I guess there are too many apple pie recipes out there that are not only delicious, but can also be pretty.  This isn't it.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2014-11-27T19:25:08.58

text:
This was so delicious!!!!  I needed to make it low sugar so I used Truvia Blend and Splenda Brown Sugar Blend... I didn't have but half of the butter so I substituted the rest with coconut oil.  I also took others advice and sprinkled the apples with cinnamon.  I was doubtful before putting it in the oven but it turned out great!  My daughter doesn't like any sugar substitutes and she said it was delicious.  Thanks for the recipe!!!

country:
None
text:
Well, I must've done something wrong. I followed directions except added the teaspoon of cinnamon and poured 2/3 of the sauce over the apples and the rest on top. The taste was fantastic but not enough of the sauce came through the lattice work.  The top crust was too crispy.  It didn't look like the picture. Also, there was a lot of liquid in the pie, so maybe the water isn't necessary.  We ate it slightly warm, but it wouldn't think that it make it that runny. I did not get rave reviews from the family like I was expecting. I would like to make it again, but will put all sauce inside, and maybe omit the water.

text:
Best. Apple. Pie. EVER. Made the sauce as-written, but had to cut back on the amount of apples, as I apparently do not own a deep-dish pie plate. This will be remedied, because this pie deserves a deep dish! The sauce needed no tampering--no cinnamon or other spices necessary, really. The apples I used were Stayman Winesap, not G.S. but they are similar in that they are firm, somewhat tart apples that hold up nicely in a pie.

text:
My picture is pre-filling. I made this pie for a work get together and my big boss came to me and said "that was the best tasting pie I have ever had in my entire life."
 I do, however-tweak it a just a little tiny bit. I use only 1/2 stick of butter and 2 table spoons of flour. I'm trying to go lighter on both still- but I'm still experimenting with the tweak-its so good-I do this because, TO ME, the whole stick of butter and all the flour makes it taste a tad heavy and a bit too much butter in the flavor-which kind of took from the desired fresh apple taste. Love this pie-Thanks Grandma Ople!

text:
Printed out the recipe two days ago and see that it's been changed--yippee!  I was going to write that you should watch the video first because the recipe used to call for water before the sugars.  If you do that (which I did), you end up with glop.  Major glop.  Because everything else was prepared, I just went ahead and plopped the glop on top!  And trust me, it does look like a Dr. Seuss creation!  Can't wait to try it again.  PS I am so sick of sugar that I used the same butter, flour & water, but only 1/4 cup of each of the sugars.  Delish!

text:
I skipped making my own crust and just bought 2 frozen pie crusts. The market didn't have deep dish so I had a huge excess of apples. I would only need about 4 instead of 8 next time. Or you could make 2 pies and double the filling part.  Also upon making, I'm not big on spending time with cutting lattice crust so that didn't work out. I just made a few triangle cuts in the top crust and poured the filling in the holes. It didn't look great but it tasted great. The filling was excellent.

Display Name:
Jen Li

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1144255.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this 6 times for picky crowds, and each time there were no leftovers. When making the filling, I followed other's recommendations and added 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg and replaced 1 tsp water with 1 tsp vanilla which added more flavor. I used the Butter Flaky Pie Crust (also found on allrecipes.com)and doubled it to make a bottom and top crust. 

I've found that mixing the filling with the apples before pouring into the pie crust was preferred over pouring it over the top crust (as instructed) because it gets distributed more evenly, especially if you cook the filling too long and the butter separates from the sugar. Otherwise, it will just clump on the top crust. 

Overall, THE best and only apple pie recipe you should use from the Internet.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2013-12-18T07:20:47.41
helpfulCount:

text:
Ive made this several times over the years, and it remains my husbands favorite pie (over store bought!).  It couldnt be easier, especially with a store bought crust.  I sometimes use a food processor to slice the apples.  I used reviewer recommendations to save a little syrup to brush on the top crust, and to add vanilla extract to the apples.  You definitely need the foil on top.  Thanks Grandma O, this hasnt failed me yet!

userID:

Display Name:
