city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
So I had a hard time determining how to rate this recipe bc it was delicious, however I had some issues with the construction. I attempted this recipe as written and although it was very tasty, when I make it again I will construct it differently.  After following the video instructions and making the filling first I ended up with solidified Carmel sauce that could not be poured into the lattice pie crust without clumping on the top of the pie and not seeping into the pie. To remedy this I made an additional batch of the filling and before it had the chance to simmer I poured it into the pie in almost liquid form. The result was delicious but not pretty presentation wise. The next time I make this I will pour the filling over top the apples before making the lattice top crust and then glaze the top part with extra mixture as other reviewers have suggested. All in all this recipe is delicious and I can't wait to perfect my own version in the future! Thanks!
Update: I made the pie again, doubled the filling, and put the filling over the apples and then did the lattice crust and it turned out beautifully. Both delicious and perfect presentation-wise!! Will make this again and again thanks!

text:
Made two of these for Thanksgiving. Wonderful! I will never use another apple pie recipe again. I was a little worried when I made them because they were so runny. This is definitely a prepare the day ahead pie. Would add a bit of cinnamon next time but that's all. So good with the all butter crust recipe from this site.

text:
This was the first time I was making apple pie ever.  This recipe is my first apple pie recipe ever, and this is my last recipe, ever.  There is no need to look for another apple pie recipe, I dont think there could be better out there.  This pie was better thank any bakery pie I ever had.  Thank you so much for posting this recipe.  It was an outstanding pie.  I used all granny smith apples, next time I will use a couple of sweeter apples as well, I used 6 nice sized apples instead of the 8.  I dint use any of the nutmeg, vanilla, cinnamon and cloves that is suggested in its many great reviews, but I will next time just because it will be for Thanksgiving and the kids will appreciate a sweeter pie.  I liked the tartness of all granny smith apples, especially with a white wine.  I poured 3/4 of the liquid into the apples and stirred.  The other 1/4 I brushed the lattice top with a pastry brush. When I baked it,  I made sure my oven rack was at the lowest position so that the bottom crust would bake.  I baked it adhering to the recipe temp and time.  It was beautiful when it cam out of the oven.  I couldnt believe I made that pie.  The brushed liquid really made the pie look gorgeous.  I cant wait to make it for my family for thanksgiving.

userID:
7840826
Display Name:
Cat
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
3
favoritesCount:
0
recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674145.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Yet another 5 star review.  Added 1 t cinnamon & 2 t vanilla paste to the caramel.  I used the Cook's Illustrated foolproof pie crust recipe. Brushed the lattice crust with the caramel & that was fantastic - it hardened into a crisp toffee-like coating.  Next time - and there will be a next time - I think I will brush the inner crust w egg white & blind bake very briefly.  Additionally I don't know if my granny smith's where unusually large but there was no way I could have gotten 8 apples worth of slices into the pie pan.  I used 5 at the most and now I have a lot of leftover slices.  

Additional tweaks I think would be worth trying - stirring in some grated cheddar cheese to the apples, subbing some red wine or bourbon for the water in the caramel, adding some very finely chopped crystalized ginger to the caramel.  There's lots of add-in's that I think would work wonderfully with this pie but as a base to work from I don't think it could be beat.

Lattice crust seems like more work than it is worth but maybe a full top crust would keep in too much moisture.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2013-02-02T19:13:05.573
helpfulCount:

Yet another 5 star review.  Added 1 t cinnamon & 2 t vanilla paste to the caramel.  I used the Cook's Illustrated foolproof pie crust recipe. Brushed the lattice crust with the caramel & that was fantastic - it hardened into a crisp toffee-like coating.  Next time - and there will be a next time - I think I will brush the inner crust w egg white & blind bake very briefly.  Additionally I don't know if my granny smith's where unusually large but there was no way I could have gotten 8 apples worth of slices into the pie pan.  I used 5 at the most and now I have a lot of leftover slices.  

Additional tweaks I think would be worth trying - stirring in some grated cheddar cheese to the apples, subbing some red wine or bourbon for the water in the caramel, adding some very finely chopped crystalized ginger to the caramel.  There's lots of add-in's that I think would work wonderfully with this pie but as a base to work from I don't think it could be beat.

Lattice crust seems like more work than it is worth but maybe a full top crust would keep in too much moisture.

text:
I made this pie for Thanksgiving and it was incredible -- by far the best apple pie I've had! This pie looks and tastes like it's difficult to make, but its not (I didn't share that with my family though!).. This is now my #1 go-to pie recipe. The only change I made was adding cinnamon to the apples, which I felt added needed flavor. I also made a pie crust with a bit of crunchy sugar in it, and rolled the dough out a bit thicker than normal.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Easy to follow. 
Tastes great. 
I am now comfortable with doing a lattice top. 
Love the idea of caramelizing the sugar first. 
And, lastly, people think I really can bake -- mission accomplished, I guess! :) 

I went ahead and added a little flour (couple table spoons) and cinnamon (teaspoon) to the apples (only 5 large granny smith apples). One of three times I also added some vanilla (don't remember how much, maybe 1/2 tsp) to the apple mixture... I don't even know if that's something anyone would do...! Oh, and I basted the bottom crust with egg. The only thing I'll say is the variations worked out great. But don't follow my adjustments before reading others', I am seriously amateur. Read other people's adjustments if you are looking for a variation to the recipe as-written.

text:
O my this pie is AMAZING! I have never made a pie from scratch before and it turned out absolutely perfect! I did make a few changes along the way but nothing major. Still followed the recipe exactly. As I was making it and cutting up the apples i noticed at 4 apples it was almost overflowing so I stoppped there. (no biggie) then i love the criss cross top on a pie but I also LOVE a crumbled topping. So what I did after following this recipe exactly, was take 1 cup of brown sugar, 1 cup of all-purpose flour, and 1/4 cup butter, diced very small and I put it in a bowl. I took my hand mixer and mixed it together. I then sprinkled this over the pie and just like that I went to heaven eating it after. It was so good and gone so fast, my fam asked me to make it again. THAT SAME WEEK! HIT!

My only criticism is that it was very soupy and you almost needed a spoon to eat it. Maybe it was just my inexperience and maybe I did not need to put the entire sugar mixture into the pie. However there is always next time.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
We LOVE this pie recipe!  Autumn is the season for harvesting Apple and Green Chilies, here in New Mexico so we adapted this pie to the season by sprinkling about 1/2 cup Freshly Grated cheddar cheese on top of the pie crust before adding the apples and we added a chopped green chili (mild to medium per your taste) to the apples before putting them in the the pie.  The result is a Wonderfully delicious apple pie with just a little heat.  This is a Southwestern Favorite!

text:
We LOVE this pie recipe!  Autumn is the season for harvesting Apple and Green Chilies, here in New Mexico so we adapted this pie to the season by sprinkling about 1/2 cup Freshly Grated cheddar cheese on top of the pie crust before adding the apples and we added a chopped green chili (mild to medium per your taste) to the apples before putting them in the the pie.  The result is a Wonderfully delicious apple pie with just a little heat.  This is a Southwestern Favorite!

text:
This apple pie recipe was great and everyone loved it. I made it for thanksgiving this year a day ahead and it still kept well until the next day. The crust I used was not as buttery and crumbly as I would have liked, but the pie and filling was great and tasted so fresh like homemade pie should! I think I used gala apples also instead of granny smith, but Im sure either would be good. I would definitely make this again but with a different crust. I also didn't do a lattice top, but poured the syrup mixture over the apples, topped it with crust (and leaf cutouts which were  a nice touch) then the rest of the sugar mix. very yummy!

text:
OMGoodness but this was sinfully delicious! I pride myself in baking a truly outstanding pie, but let me tell you, this pie --- takes the award! And now my hubby asks for this all the time!! LOL The only exceptions I made were lightly sprinkling cinnamon on my apples then mixing the sauce in with the apples leaving just enough to drizzle over my lattice. I did cover the crust edge with foil until last 20 min. And I used Golden Delicious Apples, always my choice when it comes to pie baking! Try this, you won't regret it!

Seriously, the best apple pie EVER. In hindsight, I probably should've done a practice pie to make sure all came out okay before Turkey Day. However, I didn't (do I need to have a pie for myself?) and as it turns out, I didn't have to worry, because it came out amazing. I did add some cinnamon to the caramel-like mixture just to make it a bit more seasonal, but pouring it over the crust made the apples AND the crust taste so good. I will be using this recipe from now on!

text:
If I could I would give this 10 stars. I am not a pie maker and this Thanksgiving I was a hit with this pie.  Even after being stuffed with turkey, people asked for seconds ay dessert time.   Instead of the lattice I used a crumb topping as that is a favorite with my family.  1/2 cup of flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar and 3 tbsp. butter mixed together to form the crumbs.  Yummy.......

text:
Like others, I had never attempted to make an apple pie before this.  Now it will be my signature dessert!  The grannysmith apples (tossed with a pinch of cinnamon) were perfect- crisp and not too sweet. The best though, was the drizzled lattice crust!  Definitely use all eight apples, even though they look like they won't fit.  The pie does settle while cooking, and when it's done, it's just the right size and packed with apples, as it should be.

text:
This was my first apple pie and I made it for Thanksgiving.  It was wonderful!!!  Everyone loved it. I used a crust recipe that I've used many times but the only changed I made to the recipe was to add 1 tsp. of cinnamon to the sugar sauce and I used Johna Gold apples instead of Granny Smith because I realllllllly don't like Granny Smith.  They are way too tart for me.  The  Johna Gold are slightly tart but also sweet and they worked well in the pie.  This is a keeper and one that will be requested many times I'm sure.  Thanks so much!!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This pie was very tasty and everyone liked it.  I stuck to the recipe as far as ingredients go.  One major thing that wasn't in the directions was to cover the pie with foil after the first 10-15 minutes.  The first one I baked was all burned on top.  I learned from that and the others came out beautifully.  Also, the ceramic pie plates that I used can't be above 375 degrees, so I baked mine at 350 the whole time- a bit more than an hour.  I'll definitely use this recipe again.  My one sister said she'd toss the apples with some cinnamon and sugar next time, but I liked the flavor just the way it is.

text:
This pie was so good! I have never baked a pie before and so far I have baked this one twice in a week! The first time Made it exactly as the recipe says and it turned out wonderfully, the second time I took kraft caramel squares and cut them into quarters and sprinkled them on top of the apples before I made the lattice on top and it was the most delicious apple pie I have ever tasted! Thanks so much for sharing!

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm very picky about my apple pie and this one was amazing. My boyfriend said it's by far the best he's ever tasted and he's a baked goods junkie. However, I did alter it just slightly. I mixed in with the apples about a 1/4 C. brown sugar, 2 tsp. cinnamon and a tsp. nutmeg. To be honest, I was afraid of having the apples bare in  case the syrup didn't coat them enough. And to the syrup I added about 1 tsp vanilla just for some extra flavor. It was delicious.
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
This is a 10+ star recipe, no doubt about it. I've made it probably 20 times and always get rave reviews. Numerous people have told me it's the best apple pie they've ever had. The only changes I make are to add a little cinnamon to the apples and I usually use 3-4 Granny Smiths, 2 Galas, and 1 Figi (depending on the size of the apples). Sometimes I throw a Pink Lady or something else in there too. Amazing, amazing. Thank you so much. :)

text:
I have made this pie several times already. I personally don't like any type of fruit pie but my family loves this. I made it one year for someones birthday and now I end up making several times a year for family. After reading reviews though I want to add something. MAKE IT AS IS! If you want to add cinnamon I suggest just a little mixed with the apples or sprinkled on top after you add the lattice crust and the sauce. Also the lattice crust is way easy to do. I just buy the pie crust you roll out and cut strips out of it with a pizza cutter. Sure it's the cheater way but it works just as good as anything else.
Review:

country:

text:
Made this along with my Mom's traditional Apple Pie recipe for Thanksgiving.  Well... it was a huge hit! There is nothing like your Mom's Apple Pie... but this was just as good (if not better) with just a slight twist on tradition.  If you are looking for a **** apple pie recipe, you have to try it.  It's no fail!  I did pour the liquid mixture on top of my apples and tossed in a bowl - then added them to the crust.  Slapped on the lattice top and used a pastry brush to coat the lattice... oh and I also sprinkle a bit of sugar on the top for that glistening effect.  Everyone really loved it!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
OK, I have made more apple pies than I can count in my life and I thought I had the ultimate recipe, but this one is better!   I did toss the apples with about 2TB flour mixed with about 2 tsp. cinnamon, then filled my pie pan and poured the sugar mixture over the apples before I put on the top crust.  That sugar mixture looked sort of like greasy pudding at that point and I was doubtful that this was going to work, but it all just blended beautifully with the apples during baking.  I doubled the recipe to make a 10 inch pie and really heaped it full.  I had maybe 1 cup of apples and a little sugar mix left over, but it made a very nice full, large pie.  This goes to the top of my list!

text:
I consider myself an expert pie maker and this recipe is a KEEPER! The only thing I did differently was to pour the sauce over the apples and mix it up before putting into the crust. Then I put the top crust on and cut some slits in. I love my pie crust [made w/lard] and don't do lattice much so pouring over the crust would not have worked. Excellent flavor! Thank you Moshasmama! God Bless your granny!

text:
I'm a beginner cook and have made this recipe 3 times now for different occasions and everyone LOVES this pie, young and old. I definitely added the tablespoon of vanilla, large pinch of nutmeg, and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon for flavor. I would also recommend mixing the syrup with the apples instead of pouring it over the lattice top. Otherwise it's a fabulous recipe to make, even if you're 21 years old :)

right now its a 3...i am hoping it is going to taste good.  the ingredients are all yummy so my fingers are crossed.  however, i got such a gelotenous mess i redid the sauce and couldn't get it off the stove fast enough for it not to begin to gel just like the first try.  i thought, well, maybe its suppose to melt down in when it bakes.  it's still in the oven  and i don't think it's going to melt down in.  when i added the flour i didn't get a paste but i continued and as soon as it came to a boil...so, it should be interesting.  i'll let you know how it turns out.  The pictures look so lovely that i have hope my next attempt will turn out just like them.

This recipe was amazing!!!! I just made it today and served it still warm.  I cannot put into words how delicious this pie is!  I used crispin apple(we didn't have any granny smiths), added a tsp of cinnamon,  and dash of nutmeg to it but other then that I followed the recipe exactly.  The latice topping added a great look to the pie, I also made leaf cut outs and put them on top of the latice to give it some decoration, it looked great.  I will be putting this recipe on a card and adding it to my collection.  Plus it was a relatively simple recipe which made it even better.  I 100% satisfied with this recipe.

userID:
4098692
Display Name:
Cicely Roth Reiss
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2020755.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Awesome recipe!!!  Doesn't get much better than this!  While I love the rich syrupy version created by Grandma Ople, I like my less sweet, less rich variation as well.  I fill a plastic bag with the sugars, flour and about 1 teaspoon cinnamon and the sliced apples and shake to mix well.  The sugared apples go into the crust and I evenly dot the mixture with about 1/4 c. butter, cut into pieces. I omit the water; the cooked apple juice creates a sauce of perfect amount and consistency.  I top this with a whole crust.  This apple pie is not as candy-like, but the flavor of the apples is really enhanced!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2009-10-17T21:16:06.383

text:
Awesome recipe!!!  Doesn't get much better than this!  While I love the rich syrupy version created by Grandma Ople, I like my less sweet, less rich variation as well.  I fill a plastic bag with the sugars, flour and about 1 teaspoon cinnamon and the sliced apples and shake to mix well.  The sugared apples go into the crust and I evenly dot the mixture with about 1/4 c. butter, cut into pieces. I omit the water; the cooked apple juice creates a sauce of perfect amount and consistency.  I top this with a whole crust.  This apple pie is not as candy-like, but the flavor of the apples is really enhanced!

text:
Ok, can I tell you I've never made an apple pie completely from scratch before?  I think the fact that my husband loves his Mom's apple pie has always deterred me.  However, he loooooved this and said it was even better than "Mom's".  I used Basic Flaky Pie Crust from this site.  I used gala apples and added some cinnamon and apple pie spice which I just couldn't go without!  I also got ahead of myself and poured the topping on the apples before I put the top crust on.  Oops.  It was amazingly delicious though!  Thanks for sharing the recipe!  I will definitely have this as my standard apple pie recipe now!

text:
I have to confess that I really didn't care for this recipe at all. I followed the recipe with the exception that I added cinnamon to the apples. After the hour of cooking time, the apples were still too firm but any further baking would have burned the crust. I didn't like the sugar syrup blend that you pour over the pie, it just detracted from the flavor of the apples, I definitely wouldn't make this again.

text:
Good but too much butter.  I made 2 of these pies for Easter and everything worked great, the pies looked beautiful and were tasty but the general concensus from the group was they had too much butter and were a little rich.  I would make this recipe again and only use half the amount of butter required.  I really think it would make it taste better plus cutting calories and fat means you get to have a 2nd piece. :^)

text:
I've made this pie 5 times now, and am always so happy with it... My boyfriend is an apple pie lover, so I made this for him last year. We ended up eating the entire thing in one day. He still often raves about how I make the best apple pie ever. :) Thanks to Grandma Ople's recipe, it's true! It is THE best apple pie I've tried on allrecipes, by far. I always add a little cinnamon and vanilla to the apples before putting them in the crust. I also like to mix half the sugar mixture with the apples before putting them in the crust, then will pour the remaining sugar mixture over - I like to make sure everything is fully coated. I'm going to be using this recipe forever - thank you so much!

This is the only recipe I will use for apple pie from now on.  Thanks for a great recipe

text:
I have made this probably 8 times. Excellent!!! Makes a beautiful pie that tastes amazing. I coated apples w/ about 3/4 of the syrup mixture and used the other 1/4 on the top. Need to put a cookie sheet under the pie plate b/c some of the sugary syrup does come out of the pie. Wonderful flavor and texture. Make sure to cook about 10 minutes longer or the apples may not be soft enough depending on your preference.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/148672.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The best apple pie recipe here, hands down. The sweetness of the sugars and apples seep into the crust, which makes it awesome. I tossed the apples in half of the sugar-butter mixture and poured the rest over the top crust. I also added 1 tsp cinnamon and 1/2 tsp nutmeg for more apple pie flavors. I recommend placing a pan under the pie just in case the filling overflows. Also, wrap the edges around the rim in foil, since the outer crust rim has tendency to overcook before the rest of pie is done. This apple pie is definitely worth the time and effort.
Review:

5

text:
I made this pie just a few days ago for Thanksgiving. The flavor was wonderful but I did have a problem that I'm hoping I can get some input for.  When I made the syrup, it was really more of a paste.  I had to mix it with the apples, as there was no way it was pourable to go over the top of the lattice crust.  I checked and recheck the ingredient amounts and all was fine.  It became a paste almost immediately after adding the sugars. I simmered it for a while, hoping that the sugar would liquify and it would look more like a thick syrup but that did not happen.
I would love to make this again at Christmas but I might need a practic pie beforehand!  Anyone else have the syrup become a paste?

I made this pie just a few days ago for Thanksgiving. The flavor was wonderful but I did have a problem that I'm hoping I can get some input for.  When I made the syrup, it was really more of a paste.  I had to mix it with the apples, as there was no way it was pourable to go over the top of the lattice crust. I would love to make this again at Christmas but I might need a practic pie beforehand!  Anyone else have the syrup become a paste?

text:
Awesome! I didn't change a single thing about this recipe and everyone at Thanksgiving said it was delicious. I would definitely reccommend putting a cookie sheet under the pie to catch the oozing sauce or else you will have a messy oven. I was skeptical about putting the sauce on the top of the pie, but it soaked through the holes in the lattice crust, and made the top crust crunchy, perfectly browned and delicious. The lattice crust does take some time to perfect, however!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I used the french pastry pie recipe for this pie - I added 1/2 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. cinnamon and 1/2 tsp nutmeg to the sauce and had no problems with the color at all. The sauce, combined with the french pastry pie, is what makes this pie so good. Next time I make this, I will do what others did by combining half the sauce with the apples and pour the other half over the lattice top.

text:
The taste of this pie is delicious, however, the set up was a disaster!  The caramel sauce was everywhere!  And once in the oven and reheated, it travelled again.  I followed the recipe exactly, but my apples were still a little on the crisp side.  Don't get me wrong, I will try this again because the flavors are fantastic!  Next time, when I prepare the caramel, I will toss apples in the sauce and then mound in the pie shell.  Also, I need help on the lattice work, but that takes practice.  This was my first apple pie... Thank goodness we don't care about looks around here:)  It is still getting eaten!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am completely inept when it comes to pie baking. I am the butt of family jokes. In the 14 years I've married, this pie was the very first pie I've made that has ever turned out! My husband even asked for seconds! I added 1 t of vanilla and 1/4 t of cinnamon to the syrup. I also used a crumb topping. I baked at the high temp for 10 minutes and the lower temp for 30. My apples were very tender. The apples were sliced using the pampered chef peeler/corer/slicer so they were thin and very uniform in size.

5

text:
I am completely inept when it comes to pie baking. I am the butt of family jokes. In the 14 years I've married, this pie was the very first pie I've made that has ever turned out! My husband even asked for seconds! I added 1 t of vanilla and 1/4 t of cinnamon to the syrup. I also used a crumb topping. I baked at the high temp for 10 minutes and the lower temp for 30. My apples were very tender. The apples were sliced using the pampered chef peeler/corer/slicer so they were thin and very uniform in size.

I have to give this recipe a 5 star although it was not one of my favorites but I don't care for cooked apples and have never been a fan of apple pie. I made this for my husband and he loved it! I only used 4 apples instead of 8 and two of them were golden delicious. I think next time I will try all red delicious because the Granny Smith apples were way too sour for this recipe (especially for me). But it had great flavor and held together really well!

I can't say this was the best, because it was my first. Much better making my own than the store bought I must say. I didn't have any nutmeg so I substituted a pinch of ground cloves and a pinch of allspice. I added these spices to the apples along with the cinnamon like another reviewer stated. Served it with ice cream and had absolutely no complaints. Will be making for our Winter Lunceon. Thanks!

text:
The flavor and texture were fantastic. I gave the recipe a 4 because it requires modification- I added cinnamon to the apples as other reviewers recommended. I should have also added some of the sauce to the apples and the rest to the top. The recipe as written doesn't work. That much sauce will not fit on top of the pie and is too viscous to enter the pie unless you have a very open lattice top. I didn't. It made a mess but was delicious.

This pie was okay, but nothing to write home about.  With all the 5-star reviews, I was expecting a really WOW pie.

I followed the recipe exactly - used my homemade pie crust and Granny Smith apples.  I poured the sugar syrup over the lattice as directed, but when baked, the top crust wasn't anything special.

It was fun to try something new, but next time I'll just use my standard apple pie recipe.

region:

country:
None
text:
This pie was really yummy!  I cut it while it was still hot, so maybe that is why it was really runny inside, and all the 'goo' slid out.  In any event, the taste was fantastic.  I did a regular crust on top, and just added the sugar/butter mix to the top of the apples before putting the top crust on.  I am going to try adding some cornstarch or somthing to try to thicken it up a little more for next time, but it could have just been the apples I used (organic red delicious).  This one is DEFINATELY a keeper, and everyone can make it perfectly with a little tweaking of their own.  Just try it.  You'll surprise yourself with how well you do.  Come on!

text:
I've been using the same apple pie recipe for 20 years but decided to give this one a try. I'm glad I did. I made 2 pies and gave one to my neighbor, who proclaimed this the best apple pie ever. I used deep dish pie plates so I had no problem with the pie spilling over in the oven, though I probably should have increased the amount of apples accordingly. Next time. I like the way the top crust gets a little crunchy. I mixed some lemon juice and cinnamon with the apples before putting them in the crust. Thanks for sharing Grandma's recipe.

Excellent, excellent, excellent.  This is the first pie I have ever made and I was very suprised at how good it was.  The filling was thick and delicious and didn't run out of the pie like my mom's always did.  The only thing I changed is that I tossed the apples in the hot mixture and then poured into the crust rather than pouring the liquid over the top.  I am making this again very soon!

country:
None
text:
Really good recipe. Tips:  I added 1/4 cup whiskey, 1/4 cup flour, 2 T sugar, and 1 T of apple pie spice and coated it onto the apples, and let it sit in my fridge for 10 mins.  After taking it out, I spooned out the apples into the crust with a slotted spoon so that some of the marinade didn't make the pie runny. Just follow the recipe after that. It turned out fantastic!

text:
Really good recipe. Tips:  I added 1/4 cup whiskey, 1/4 cup flour, 2 T sugar, and 1 T of apple pie spice and coated it onto the apples, and let it sit in my fridge for 10 mins.  After taking it out, I spooned out the apples into the crust with a slotted spoon so that some of the marinade didn't make the pie runny. Just follow the recipe after that. It turned out fantastic!

text:
I have made this pie very many times and everytime I do it gets scarfed up! My father hates cinnamon and therefore had avoided apple pies. I made this for him and insisted he try, now he raves to everyone about how great my pies are! Thanks to the author of course! I also substituted the apples for fresh picked pears, and there results are fantastic! I even mixed apples and pears! I am not good at the lattice top crust so I just put a full crust on top after adding the sauce in then top the crust with a little bit more of the sauce half way through baking! Awsome pie!

text:
I had never made an apple pie and after searching the site and reading the reviews I decided to try this one.  I am so glad that I did.  I made two of these for Easter dinner this year. It was delicious and so easy to make, everyone loved it.  My husband thought that it lacked cinnamon.  I thought so too at first but then decided it was great as it was.  It seemed even better the second day as the sauce seemed to set.  I was concerned that not all of the apples would be covered with the sauce but there was no need to worry.  We really enjoyed how the top crust was carmelized.  This is an excellent pie and I will make it many more times. Oh...I used cortland apples.  Thanks!

I have made this twice for Irish friends who detest cinnamon in their pie. It is super easy with my handy dandy apple gadget I got from a certain kitchen gadget party! It really is a great pie, I used ready made pie crust and another gadget, the crinkle cutter, to make the lattice. This pie is a snap to make, and I am finding out that I don't care too much for cinnamon and spice in my pie either. Just apples, crust and buttery caramel!!

text:
Made this for the second time and can't say enough about how wonderful it is.  I used a latice crust and mixed half of the sauce with the apples before placing into the crust and poured the remaining sauce over the top after I finished the top crust.  I also added 1 tsp. of cinnamon to the sauce and sprinkled a bit on the top.  It turned out picture perfect and tasted fabulous! Thank you for sharing!

text:
This is a great recipe if you add cinnamon! My husband and sons all loved this one. Very quick and easy. I even forgot to simmer the sauce and it turned out great. I used pre-made pie shells and found I had to put them on a cookie sheet because they overflowed the pie. A larger pie shell may not have this trouble.
